Rothschild Capital Management Limited (JRCM), combines investment expertise with access to high quality deal flow.  The essence of JRCM’s investment approach is to combine capital preservation with capital growth over the long term. Since 1988, RIT has delivered outstanding performance for its shareholders. Over the last ten years, a RIT shareholder has seen a NAV per share total return of 109%¹. A shareholder who invested in RIT at inception will have seen a share price total return of 10.6% per annum. Find out more Based in historic Spencer House, RIT traces its origins back to 1971 when Jacob Rothschild was appointed chairman of a £5 million Investment Trust. Today RIT has net assets of over £3.5 billion². ¹ With dividends reinvested.
